intro: Hancockia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower hancockia, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly found in the southeastern region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. Hancockia uniflora features slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves, with a single flower head at the top of each stem. It is a perennial species that blooms in late summer, producing small, yellowish to brownish flower heads.
